column3: ACK on the last line and the one comment change, conceptual ACK on either removing the comments that say "//TODO" or the whole line, whichever people think is a better idea.\n
@TheBlueMatt Removing what exactly will make this an ACK from you, didn't get it, sorry.\n
If the code in question is supposed to be never reached (and thus it is undefined behaviour to get there), keeping an assert there is the proper thing to do.\n
@laanwj So keep the asserts and remove the "dead code" below them and the Todo comment?\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4782_2e5361b9c20517a22a4d1fdae3077d23800ecba7/ for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-te

Why was this added as a TODO in the first place? It's not that removing a line is so much work that it needs to be postponed. This makes me think there is some more to be done here before it can be safely removed.\n
I see that limitedmap.h was added by @thebluematt, with TODO and all. Any specific reason that this was added as a TODO?\n
I believe the thought was "I'll leave this here until we waited a while and never hit this, then we can be reasonably sure its actually as dead code as I think it is".\n
